Cards Release Notes (version 03.59.30.23-11)

Revision #1 (See revision history in section [Revision History].

This document contains an overview of the most significant changes; release and lists all changes (fixes and enhancements). A Customer s specific licenses determine whether a change is available. If you have any questions, please contact your Business Relation Manager.

To see Major Modifications and Enhancements, click on the [Release Highlights] link.

To see Upgrade Notes for impact changes, click on the [Upgrade Notes for impact changes] link or [Grouped by Releases] link.

To see Check Scripts, click on the [Grouped by Products] link or [Grouped by Releases] link.

Click on the appropriate link to see the full list of changes: [Grouped by Products] or [Grouped by Releases].

Release Highlights

Major Modifications and Enhancements in the version.

DB kernel

CARDS-81613

Added support for running Desktop Client and Cards Wizards on JDK 17. 
Please refer to "Java for Way4" standard manual for a list of supported vendors and JDK versions. Migration to new Java version and vendor requires separate migration projects with the Licensor.
Updated Manuals: DB kernel | Java_for_Way4

Upgrade Notes on Impact Changes

Important! These changes may affect your data, please read carefully!

Acquiring authorisation

CARDS-81905

Added a script for checking DYNAMIC_MERCH_MODE, DYNAMIC_MERCH_MODE_MC, DYNAMIC_MERCH_MODE_AMEX parameters.
Upgrade Note:
Run the script CARDS-81585_check_DYNAMIC_MERCH_MODE.sql and send the result to Customer Support. This information is required for internal analysis of customer configurations for purposes of product development.
Check Scripts:
CARDS-81585_check_DYNAMIC_MERCH_MODE.sql

Application management

CARDS-72679

Added storing of the AUTH_KEY_STORAGE_FORM global parameter value in pm_keys.storage_form field during application processing.
Upgrade Note:
The pm_keys.storage_form value is now taken from the AUTH_KEY_STORAGE_FORM global parameter value, which has no default value and must be defined mandatoryly.

CARDS-79657

Modified Counterparty application batch processing so that Counterparty Address is not replaced by  client/contract address and to check PartyType value for compatibility with SEPA_MNDT_PARTY_TYPE_CP parameter value. Fixed synchronization and automatic filling of empty Counterparty / Payer / Payee English address fields using automatic transliteration from the corresponding non-English fields.
Upgrade Note:
Synchronization and automatic fill of the Counterparty / Payer/ Payee English-language address fields, when empty, with automatic transliteration of data contained in these fields' non-English-language can override the existing values of Counterparty / Payer/ Payee English address using the advanced application processing for a non-English address update.
Previous behavior: if English address data is not provided in the advanced application for Counterparty (AddressLine* for Language = "ENG"), the corresponding fields are not updated in the DB.
New behavior: if English address data is not provided in the advanced application for Counterparty, they will be filled from the non-English pairs with automatic transliteration.
To prevent synchronization, pairs of fields for both languages should be transferred in the Advanced Application.

CARDS-79803

Fixed an application validation error "Multiple Appl Info Types found by code". 
When creating an application tree for an "Application Additional Information" node, the code and group code of the "Application Info Type" (appl_info) will be automatically filled in with the code and group code in a separate application field to avoid this error.
Upgrade Note:
To check the Application Info Type table for the delimiter symbol used in code and group code values use the script check_appl_info_type.sql. If such values are found by the script, the symbol should be manually removed, for example in the screen "ROOT\OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Application Info Types".
Check Scripts:
check_appl_info_type.sql

CARDS-80603

Modified processing of the AppInfo application (ObjectType=ContractAddInfo and ClientAddInfo) with Action Type=Delete. If the record to delete was absent, the "ApplInfo not found for Delete" error will be generated.
Upgrade Note:
Modified processing of the AppInfo application (ObjectType=ContractAddInfo and ClientAddInfo) with Action Type=Delete.
Previously when the record to delete was absent,  the system finished an application successfully without any actions. Now the "ApplInfo not found for Delete" error will be generated. Previous behavior is not supported.

CARDS-81041

Modified standard data in TVF_TAG for object code "APPL_PREFERRED.CUSTOM_PARMS" by changing the code of the tag "TAGS" to "TAG".
Upgrade Note:
Modified standard data in TVF_TAG for object code "APPL_PREFERRED.CUSTOM_PARMS" by changing the code of the tag "TAGS" to "TAG" during upgrade.

Configuration inspector

CARDS-80181

Modified the "NW Group" form to show the Code field and check the uniqueness and mandatory presence of its value.
Upgrade Note:
Added an upgrade script to generate a value for nw_group.code field when empty. The value is generated as a combination of nw_area.code and capital letters of nw_group.name separated by an underscore. In the case of non-unique codes, they will be extended by a sequence number in order of group record ID.

Customer/account management

CARDS-80781

Added auto-generation of a Counterparty Code when creating a Counterparty for non-SEPA payment types.
Upgrade Note:
Previously it was mandatory to define the Counterparty Code when creating from interfaces, now the value can be empty.

CARDS-79083

Added inheritance of counterparty data (name, address etc) for party type="Counterparty" and corrected filling of IBAN and MemberID in document invoice parties for "Counterparty Bank" and "Counterparty Corr Bank" party types. IBAN and MemberID synchronization is supported from "Counterparty", "Payer", "Payee" party types to counterparty / mandate record when there is an empty IBAN or MemberID in the counterparty / mandate record.
Upgrade Note:
Tags PAYER_CONTRACT / PAYEE_CONTRACT in transaction subtypes processing removed from code. Now INVOICE_PARTY type selection is performed based on CORE_BANKING tag in transaction subtypes. The upgrade script update_column_offline_nch_trans_subtype.sql will remove obsolete PAYER_CONTRACT / PAYEE_CONTRACT tags configuration.

For "Counterparty" party type, Name and address data are inherited from client's or contract's address data, when non specified during creation. The address data is inherited from the address type specified in the parameter DEF_ADDRESS_TYPE_PAYER (by default REG_ADDR).

Desktop Client

WM-4091

Ended support of Remote Access Server for RHEL7 OS starting from June 30, 2024.
Upgrade Note:
Ended support of Remote Access Server for the RHEL7 OS starting from June 30, 2024.
Updated Manuals: Remote access | Technical Requirements

WM-4261

Introduced new desktop-client.bat startup file in OWS_HOME versions 03.58.30 and 03.59.30 as an upcoming replacement for <HOME_CARDS>\client\way4manager\dbmanager\way4manager(64).exe files. Starting from OWS_HOME version 03.60.30, way4manager(64).exe files will be decommissioned and removed from the distribution.
Upgrade Note:
Replace any usage of way4manager.exe and way4manager64.exe with desktop-client.bat.
Check and update any third-party tools or scripts that automate running these applications to ensure compatibility with desktop-client.bat.
Note that .exe files will not be executable by default in 03.58 and 03.59 versions and will be removed starting from version 03.60.
Ensure these changes are implemented to continue seamless operation with the new version. 
If you need assistance, contact OpenWay Customer Support.

Instalment management

CARDS-82381 / OWS-80750

Fixed the interest accrual for a secondary plan created after the Early Repayment action, which was performed during the month with 31days and Instalment Fee calculation schemes "Interest with USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=N" or "Interest" with global parameter USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=N configuration.
Upgrade Note:
Previously when Early repayment was performed in a month with 31 days and Fee calculation schemes "Interest with INTEREST_DELAY=N" or "Interest" with global parameter USE_MONTH_WEIGHT=N were used, interest was accrued with one extra 31st day of a month calculation. Now interest is accrued assuming 30 days per month. The regression tests should be changed accordingly.

Issuing

CARDS-79207

Started to take into account the CLOSE_PREV_PLASTIC parameter value from FI and card subtype levels during the processing of the first operation with the new plastic in the case when the global parameter CLOSE_PREV_PLASTIC has the values N or A.
Upgrade Note:
The preliminary script finds configurations that affect the closing of the previous plastic on the first card transaction and that may work differently in the new version. It is necessary to check the results of the script and adjust the settings if required.
Check Scripts:
CARDS-79207-check-close-prev-plastic-configuration.sql

MasterCard interface

CARDS-80021

Deleted the tag CHANGE_CURR_IN=643810; in the subitems in the MPE processing menu items.
Upgrade Note:
Customers that use 810 currency code should check their configuration and if it is necessary to add CHANGE_CURR_IN=643810 in the proper MPE processing menu items.

CARDS-81827

Added ZIMBABWE GOLD currency to the default currencies set. Modified COUNTRY table to set new currency for country Zimbabwe. Changes made according to the GLB 10225.1 article of the 24.Q3 Mastercard release manual, and will be available only in new installations. For existing installations, manual actions are required.
Upgrade Note:
A manual addition of a new currency to the Currency Table is required: Full Name ZIMBABWE GOLD, Name ZWG, Code 924 and Exponent 2 (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Currency Table). Also this currency should be set for country Zimbabwe (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table).

CARDS-81969

Added domain values in handbook. Changes made according to the 9370.1 GLB Revised Standards Mastercard manual.
Upgrade Note:
To support Mastercard bulletin 9370.1 GLB, the following records must be added to "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Custom Handbooks":
- 'Data Value'='54'; 'Display Value'='54 First-Party Fraud';'Filter Value'='DSP_SAFE_TYPE_E'; 'Handbook Type'='NEW_CM_CASE_ADD_PARMS_VAL'.
Also, clients who use Mastercom must add the following records to "OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Client Classifiers\Custom Handbooks":
- 'Data Value'='54'; 'Display Value'='54 First-Party Fraud';'Filter Value'='DSP_SAFE_TYPE_c'; 'Handbook Type'='NEW_CM_CASE_ADD_PARMS_VAL'.

Product management

CARDS-79887

Added unique identifiers for Service Packages (SERV_PACK_IDT field) which are generated automatically on Service Package approval, based on several values: Name, Financial Institution, Contract Category, Client Category, and Contract Type. To provide uniqueness, the postfix "_1" is added to the Name value if several records have the same values.
Upgrade Note:
Unique identifiers initial generation for Service Packages will happen automatically during the upgrade, based on Service Package Name, Financial Institution, Contract Category, Client Category, and Contract Type. To provide identifier uniqueness, a postfix "_1" will be added to the Name if several records have a non-unique combination of field values, several postfixes can be added.
Updated Manuals: Product management | Service_Packages

CARDS-80137

Changed the default value of the global parameter UNIQUE_SERVICE_IDT to Y.
Upgrade Note:
With UNIQUE_SERVICE_IDT=Y (new default value), an error message will be returned when a non-unique service identifier without 'AUTOGEN:' prefix is found on Service Pack approval. It is recommended to make identifiers unique manually to achieve successful Service Pack approval.
Updated Manuals: Core | Global_Parameters

CARDS-80441

Implemented the ability to redefine default behavior for events: when the global parameter NOT_USED_IN_CHAIN=Y is set, all Event Types are processed as having the NOT_USED_IN_CHAIN tag set in Special Parms.
The parameter can be used together with the USED_IN_CHAIN tag to switch to the opposite behavior for the particular Event Type.
Upgrade Note:
Before setting the global parameter NOT_USED_IN_CHAIN=Y, full product regression is required.

SEPA interface

CARDS-81411

Modified check of SEPA mandate period consistency and possible overlap with other active contract mandates. 
Before: mandate cancelation date was not counted; for clients mandate period consistency was not checked.
Now: cancelation date is counted when checking overlapping periods; the check is run for client and contract mandates.
Upgrade Note:
Previous behavior is not supported. If Advanced Applications R2 are used for creating mandates, it is necessary to check that business processes do not involve overlapping activity periods (including cancelation date).

Tariff management

CARDS-81335

Implemented the ability to load personal GL tariffs for exceptional cases. Generally instead of a personal GL tariff, a global tariff with a personal subsidiary GL number should be used.
Upgrade Note:
GL tariff personalization is now restricted unless the new PERSONAL_GL_TRF global parameter is set.
Check Scripts:
CARDS-81335_personal_gl_tariffs.sql

Transaction management

CARDS-80593

Removed the outdated "Fill" procedure from Desktop Client forms for managing transaction types.
This change impacts the following Desktop Client forms within the "ROOT\OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Transaction Types" menu group:
- "Transactions - All"
- "Acq --> Iss Transaction Types"
- "Iss --> Acq Transaction Types"
- "Accounting Transaction Types"
- "Interbank Transaction Types"
- "Settlement Transaction Types"
- "Payment Types"
The generation of unique RBS Code and RBS Reversal Code was moved to the "Check All" procedure.
Upgrade Note:
Added a check to the "Check All" procedure to identify message types with empty message codes exist. If such cases are found, the corresponding error message is written to the process log.
It is recommended to delete existing not used message type records that have empty codes.

CARDS-80797

Fixed an issue on document acceptance when the document's target or source category were different from the target or source contract's category.
Upgrade Note:
Fixed an issue with incorrect doc.s_cat or doc.t_cat values filling during document acceptance. Previously source and target categories were filled based on the transaction type's configuration, now these fields will be filled based on the transaction subtype. Impact on custom reports should be assessed, standard journals of PI test scripts might need to be updated accordingly.

CARDS-81755 / OWS-76948

Removed filling account currency in DOC.TRANS_CURR for documents created by Misc service implemented in CARDS-70844.
Upgrade Note:
Removed filling account currency in DOC.TRANS_CURR for documents created by Misc service. Cardholder Contract Statement report will display the Misc fees currency without fractional part and without currency.

CARDS-81829 / OWS-79447

Fixed the calculation of the remaining amount to be blocked after processing the multiple clearing portion. The remaining fee amounts are now recalculated and blocked together with the remaining base amount. The remaining amounts are calculated based on the proportion of the clearing portion's settlement amount to the unblocked amount.
Fees with fixed amounts are also re-calculated based on this proportion; therefore, the final fee amount posted to the customer account may differ from the blocked remaining fee amount.
If the option FROM_AUTH=FEE_AMOUNT is used for the service, the remaining fee amount is not blocked, as it is expected that the full authorized fee amount will be posted when processing the first clearing portion.
Upgrade Note:
Fixed the calculation of the remaining amount to be blocked after processing the multiple clearing portion. The remaining fee amounts are now recalculated and blocked together with the remaining base amount.
Previously only the remaining base amount was blocked.

VISA interface

CARDS-80991

Changed how ARN is calculated in VISA BASEII Outward Processing pipe for OnUs transactions. If the parameter CALC_ARN_ALWAYS = N, ARN is not calculated but taken directly from the document. By default CALC_ARN_ALWAYS = Y.
Upgrade Note:
To use the parameter CALC_ARN_ALWAYS, it is necessary to add a new parameter to NW Area VISA Outward:
Name = Always calculate new ARN for ONUS transactions
Code = CALC_ARN_ALWAYS
Default Value = Y

Then this parameter can be added to the NW Group that is used in Bank Acquiring Parameters for the particular member.

CARDS-81151

Fixed Fee Prediction calculating between France and French Territories.
Upgrade Note:
The customers who have merchants in France and have Fee Prediction license need to run the script db\datax\config\VISA\VISA_RA_AREA_CFG.sql, which creates a new Country Area.

WS Runtime

WSRT-695

Updated Oracle JDBC thin driver version from 12.2 up to 19.22 (jdk 1.8).
Upgrade Note:
To rollback to previous version replace libraries in the folder
<ts>\webapps\<ts>\WEB-INF\lib\jdbc:
ojdbc8.jar by the ojdbc8-12.2.0.1-27653480.jar
orai18n.jar by the orai18n-12.2.0.1.0.jar

WSRT-683

Fixed processing of the default_translation_mode WS Runtime parameter.
Upgrade Note:
Now when the "none" or "display" value of the default_translation_mode parameter is set, the data value or display value is returned for dddws and listboxes respectively for WS, as expected.
Previously, concatenation of data_value, data_display_separator parameter value and display_value was always returned, which corresponded to the "data_display" value of the default_translation_mode parameter.
If a default_translation_mode parameter value, different from "data_display", is in use, it's necessary to change it to "data_display" to keep the previous system behavior.

      Upgrade Note:
      The customers who have merchants in France and have Fee Prediction license need to run the script db\datax\config\VISA\VISA_RA_AREA_CFG.sql, which creates a new Country Area.
    • CARDS-81411
      • Modified check of SEPA mandate period consistency and possible overlap with other active contract mandates. 
Before: mandate cancelation date was not counted; for clients mandate period consistency was not checked.
Now: cancelation date is counted when checking overlapping periods; the check is run for client and contract mandates.
      Upgrade Note:
      Previous behavior is not supported. If Advanced Applications R2 are used for creating mandates, it is necessary to check that business processes do not involve overlapping activity periods (including cancelation date).
    • CARDS-81827
      • Added ZIMBABWE GOLD currency to the default currencies set. Modified COUNTRY table to set new currency for country Zimbabwe. Changes made according to the GLB 10225.1 article of the 24.Q3 Mastercard release manual, and will be available only in new installations. For existing installations, manual actions are required.
      Upgrade Note:
      A manual addition of a new currency to the Currency Table is required: Full Name ZIMBABWE GOLD, Name ZWG, Code 924 and Exponent 2 (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Currency Table). Also this currency should be set for country Zimbabwe (OpenWay\Full\Configuration Setup\Main Tables\Country Table).
    • WSRT-695
      • Updated Oracle JDBC thin driver version from 12.2 up to 19.22 (jdk 1.8).
      Upgrade Note:
      To rollback to previous version replace libraries in the folder
<ts>\webapps\<ts>\WEB-INF\lib\jdbc:
ojdbc8.jar by the ojdbc8-12.2.0.1-27653480.jar
orai18n.jar by the orai18n-12.2.0.1.0.jar
    • WSRT-683
      • Fixed processing of the default_translation_mode WS Runtime parameter.
      Upgrade Note:
      Now when the "none" or "display" value of the default_translation_mode parameter is set, the data value or display value is returned for dddws and listboxes respectively for WS, as expected.
Previously, concatenation of data_value, data_display_separator parameter value and display_value was always returned, which corresponded to the "data_display" value of the default_translation_mode parameter.
If a default_translation_mode parameter value, different from "data_display", is in use, it's necessary to change it to "data_display" to keep the previous system behavior.
    • WM-4091
      • Ended support of Remote Access Server for RHEL7 OS starting from June 30, 2024.
      Upgrade Note:
      Ended support of Remote Access Server for the RHEL7 OS starting from June 30, 2024.
      Updated Manuals: Remote access | Technical Requirements
    • WM-4261
      • Introduced new desktop-client.bat startup file in OWS_HOME versions 03.58.30 and 03.59.30 as an upcoming replacement for <HOME_CARDS>\client\way4manager\dbmanager\way4manager(64).exe files. Starting from OWS_HOME version 03.60.30, way4manager(64).exe files will be decommissioned and removed from the distribution.
      Upgrade Note:
      Replace any usage of way4manager.exe and way4manager64.exe with desktop-client.bat.
Check and update any third-party tools or scripts that automate running these applications to ensure compatibility with desktop-client.bat.
Note that .exe files will not be executable by default in 03.58 and 03.59 versions and will be removed starting from version 03.60.
Ensure these changes are implemented to continue seamless operation with the new version. 
If you need assistance, contact OpenWay Customer Support.

Check Scripts Grouped by Products

There are following types of non-upgrade scripts: preliminary scripts (scripts show if customer has configuration or data, which will be impacted on new version), diagnostic scripts (scripts collect some configuration/data statistics).

For more information and description of the execution procedure, see the "Upgrade" document (db_kernel\Upgrade.pdf).

    Application management

  • CARDS-79803
    • Fixed an application validation error "Multiple Appl Info Types found by code". 
When creating an application tree for an "Application Additional Information" node, the code and group code of the "Application Info Type" (appl_info) will be automatically filled in with the code and group code in a separate application field to avoid this error.
    Upgrade Note:
    To check the Application Info Type table for the delimiter symbol used in code and group code values use the script check_appl_info_type.sql. If such values are found by the script, the symbol should be manually removed, for example in the screen "ROOT\OpenWay\Advanced Applications R2\Setup\Application Info Types".
    Check Scripts:
    check_appl_info_type.sql

    • Marked Service and Service Package identifier fields as Code field types in the Configuration inspector merge setup.

  • DBK-9087

    • Modified the "Copy Configuration Export Screen" form: the "Posting Status" field is now updation from "Waiting" to "Exported" after the "Export" action is performed. Removed the "Ext Data" field as unused.

  • CARDS-80181

    • Modified the "NW Group" form to show the Code field and check the uniqueness and mandatory presence of its value.

    • Modified contract ADD_INFO_01-04 fields type to Basic to be imported by Copy Configuration Inspector.

  • OWS-77745/DBK-9249

    • Modified Copy Configuration to allow "Export Merge Results" not only after "Merge with Standard" action, but also after "Import Merged Data" action

    Core

  • CARDS-80661

    • Implemented the ability to define FX rules, including FX type, FX rate and FX markup via tariffs at the product or contract level as default rates. This feature allows FX rules to be redefined based on a custom Internal or external FX rates.

  • CARDS-79783

    • Implemented the ability to waive interest for partial payments before the specified contract functional date.

  • CARDS-80219

    • Implemented the ability to search in a hierarchy a contract, which contract role corresponds to the value of another contract parameter, using CONTRACT_FOR or EFF_CONTRACT tags.

  • CARDS-80229

    • Extended Balance Types validation to restrict simultaneous use of BY_CURR and COUNTER_ONLY tags.

  • OWS-76661/CARDS-80439

    • Excluded balance types with empty codes from caching to avoid errors on posting.

  • CARDS-80639

    • Introduced status for a Counterparty. Added new "Active", "Inactive", "Draft", "Closed" and "Rejected" values for the "Is Active" field in the Contract Counterparty form.

  • CARDS-80663

    • Added the ability to redefine internal FX rates for calculation of a Multi-currency Travel Card with shared balance amount available and use set of rates applied during authorization for posting.

  • CARDS-81099

    • Supported "Date Time" format for the "Date" field in forms for external FX rates: "Channel Rates on Date.srd", "Channel Rates Last.srd" and "Channel Rates.srd" for fast-changing trade rates.

  • CARDS-81227

    • Supported the ability to automatically add a card to an acquirer stop list for all merchants.

  • CARDS-81657

    • Improved procedure to change user and language used by UFX and WS. Added backward compatibility check.

  • CARDS-82257

    • Modified doc/release-notes/release_notes.txt contents. Now the static part of the file with changes from old Cards versions (up to 03.52.30) is moved to a separate file archive-release-notes.txt. The original release_notes.txt file now contains only changes from the recent Cards releases, starting from 03.53.30.

  • CARDS-80097

    • Fixed Check procedure for Event Types with CLOSE_IF_EMPTY tag and CHECK_ACCOUNTS tag modifier used in configuration for acquiring contract closure process.

  • CARDS-80249

    • Improved performance for processing custom fees with tariffs during posting on Reversal. Tariff and account search are skipped for custom fees which were not applicable for initial Advice.

  • CARDS-80269

    • Implemented an ability to switch on and off the OTB high concurrency standard core functionality for a particular contract.

    Updated Manuals: Issuing | Iss_OTB_High_Concurrency

  • CARDS-80493

    • Fixed interest waiving by partial payments for the case when the specified contract functional date has the tag IN_THE_MORNING=N.

  • OWS-77302/CARDS-80805

    • Optimized performance of the upgrade script for initial generation of Service Packages unique identifiers.

  • CARDS-80889

    • Improved performance of event posting within CDU and Posting processes.

  • CARDS-81261

    • Added the "Apply Rules" field to the "Tariff Data - FX" form for tariffs with the Conversion role.

  • CARDS-81457

    • Fixed default conversion rates redefinition when FX_TYPE is defined in Account Scheme.

  • OWCPE-51375/CARDS-81495

    • Improved performance for processing conditional custom fees with tariffs and <CALC> tag during posting. Tariff search is now skipped for custom fees with <CALC> tag which are not applicable according to conditions in service details.

  • CARDS-81503

    • Fixed FX rate inheriting from authorization to financial document for multi-currency contract that uses incremental external rates and FROM_AUTH=FX_RATE service rule.

  • OWS-78532/CARDS-81581

    • Fixed an error "Product search by codes failed: No matching product found" that happened during copying of financial institution configuration when copying banking contracts that have products with a parent product.

  • CARDS-81701

    • Removed raising the error "Specified Date Type is not defined for the contract" on setting the Billing Day contract parameter/classifier for a new contract when dependent dates recalculation is configured (RECALC_DATES tags is set for Billing Date functional date template) and the dependent dates have not been calculated for the contract yet because the first billing cycle has not been closed yet.

  • CARDS-81841

    • Removed UTC offset definition on FX type for incrementally loaded conversion rates. Implemented ability to process UTC offset via WS API input parameter.

  • CARDS-82003

    • Fixed FX rate inheriting from authorization to financial document for multi-currency contract that uses bank internal rates and FROM_AUTH=FX_RATE service rule.

  • CARDS-82017

    • Supported USE_DEF_FX_TRF parameter redefinition on Financial Institution level.

  • CARDS-82189

    • Fixed parsing of CR_% tag for FX Types to allow alphanumeric FX type codes.

  • CARDS-82193

    • Fixed IF_CURRENCY check for Preferred when counterparty is absent for the document.

  • OWS-78169/CARDS-82219

    • Fixed an error in Contracts Daily Update and Apply Additional Balances when ENTRY_N field exceeds its limit for "Life to Date" counters for Banking contracts in the case when BAL_TYPE tag is used for custom fees and Balance type was not marked with the tag BANKING=SKIP.

  • CARDS-82221

    • Fixed error "Character string buffer too small" while processing a transaction by service with ACTIVITY_FOR tag for clients without DB Publisher configuration.

  • CARDS-79721

    • Added new document "High concurrency parallel processing of authorizations and transactions for hierarchies having a very large number of cards with a shared OTB" (Iss_OTB_High_Concurrency.pdf). The functionality requires a separate license.

IBAN and MemberID synchronization is supported from "Counterparty", "Payer", "Payee" party types to counterparty / mandate record when there is an empty IBAN or MemberID in the counterparty / mandate record.

    • Improved the report Cardholder_Contract_Statement in xml format with new field "INST_CHAIN_IDT" in <G_INST> node. Field contains the unique identifier of instalment chain, allowing to link instalment plans created by secondary actions (Early Repayment, Change Terms, Payment Holidays, backdated processing, etc) with the original plan.

  • OWS-80621/CARDS-82079

    • Fixed Intelligent Backdated processing for Liability sub contracts: now if a parent Liability contract was closed during the correction period, within backdated processing it will be reopened to reapply necessary actions and closed again.

  • CARDS-82165

    • Fixed the issue where device parameters were not updated after changing the device liability contract, if the device's own address is not configured.

    Instalment management

  • CARDS-78495

    • Supported Visa Instalment Solutions (VIS). Instalment plan creation is initiated based on the APIs callback processing from Visa using the new TS Adapter: the issuer matches the plan acceptance details supplied in the callback to the authorization details and creates an instalment plan using the tariffs and calculation methods configured in the Instalment Module.

  • CARDS-79789

    • Added the possibility to skip Visa Instalment Service plan creation during processing of an "Instalment Transaction Status Change" callback in the "CONFIRMED" status to use custom logic of plan creation instead. For this, set the global parameterVISA_INST_DOC_TAG=SKIP.

  • CARDS-79795

    • Added the ability to save in the document addendum Visa Instalments callback requests in JSON format. Changed JSON storage place in an addendum: tags are saved in the buf1 field and JSON in the buf2. Added the ability to redefine the global parameter VISA_INST_DOC_TAG for a financial institution by using a tag with the same name.

  • CARDS-81763

    • Supported the ability to accrue the daily interest on instalment loans on a separate account, when plan is considered as a bad debt because of overdue for more than a specified number of days. Special invoice event will be used to accrue interest on such overdue plans and to transfer the corresponding to the paid past interest due amount to the general Daily Interest Accrue account.

  • CARDS-82087

    • Supported control tags IF_CS, IF_PARM, IF_COMPARE processing for invoice events.

  • OWCPE-43300/CARDS-79591

  • OWS-53557/CARDS-79679

    • Fixed calculating a new plan tenor when Payment Holidays are granted with "All in first portion" (N) or "No fee" (W) mode and the global parameter INST_HOLIDAYS_FOR_OPEN=Y.

  • CARDS-79753

    • Fixed the instalment calculation parameters inheritance from a plan that was manually created for an authorization document, in case of plan recalculation because of adjustment processing for the original document.

  • CARDS-79831

    • Changed the status of the first in the sequence "Instalment Transaction Status Change Callback" request, processed by default, from "PENDING_AUTHORIZATION" to the "PENDING_CONFIRMATION" for Visa instalments.

  • CARDS-80131

    • Changed approach for Visa Instalment Solutions (VIS) API "Installment Transaction Status Change Callback" processing and document search. Now transactionAmount and authCode API parameters value are not analyzed and document search is performed by vTransactionID API parameter values.

  • CARDS-80367

    • Fixed saving decrypted PAN in document addendum tag ACNT_NUM during Plan Acceptance Status Change callback processing.

  • CARDS-82163

    • Fixed a transaction from previous cycle conversion into instalment with backdated processing when there was a payment after the transaction. Previously conversion was Rejected with the error message: "Instalment plan has already been created, paid (may be partially) and closed for the Document chain". Now the transaction is successfully converted into an instalment plan.

  • OWS-79447/CARDS-81829

    • Fixed the calculation of the remaining amount to be blocked after processing the multiple clearing portion. The remaining fee amounts are now recalculated and blocked together with the remaining base amount. The remaining amounts are calculated based on the proportion of the clearing portion's settlement amount to the unblocked amount. Fees with fixed amounts are also re-calculated based on this proportion; therefore, the final fee amount posted to the customer account may differ from the blocked remaining fee amount. If the option FROM_AUTH=FEE_AMOUNT is used for the service, the remaining fee amount is not blocked, as it is expected that the full authorized fee amount will be posted when processing the first clearing portion.

      • OWS-79447/CARDS-81829 [Transaction management] Fixed the calculation of the remaining amount to be blocked after processing the multiple clearing portion. The remaining fee amounts are now recalculated and blocked together with the remaining base amount. The remaining amounts are calculated based on the proportion of the clearing portion's settlement amount to the unblocked amount. Fees with fixed amounts are also re-calculated based on this proportion; therefore, the final fee amount posted to the customer account may differ from the blocked remaining fee amount. If the option FROM_AUTH=FEE_AMOUNT is used for the service, the remaining fee amount is not blocked, as it is expected that the full authorized fee amount will be posted when processing the first clearing portion.
      • CARDS-82163 [Instalment management] Fixed a transaction from previous cycle conversion into instalment with backdated processing when there was a payment after the transaction. Previously conversion was Rejected with the error message: "Instalment plan has already been created, paid (may be partially) and closed for the Document chain". Now the transaction is successfully converted into an instalment plan.

      • CARDS-82303 [High availability] Fixed an error on authorizations on Secondary node after moving from Primary, when High concurrency contract had no parallel lines on Primary.

      • WM-4243 [Desktop Client] Optimized data export to Excel files executed by "Data -> Save Data" functionality to avoid Out Of Memory errors.
      • WM-4293 [Desktop Client] Added new privilege sys.editable_sql_executor to allow modification of data queried via "SQL Executor". Updated Manuals: Desktop Client | Desktop_Client_User_Management
      • WM-4349 [Desktop Client] Added new menu item that can only be opened by a security administrator for viewing user groups menu access: ROOT\OpenWay\Full\DB Administrator Utilities\Users & Grants\User Groups Access View. Updated Manuals: Desktop Client | Desktop_Client_User_Management
      • WM-4047 [Desktop Client] Added the ability to export data to an Excel file via the "Save Data" button. Added the "Use original values" checkbox in case of non-masked values needing to be exported. Updated Manuals: Desktop Client | Desktop_Client_Manual
      • WM-4053 [Desktop Client] Fixed menu item migration process for "LIKE" query operator, whose string pattern could be wrongly interpreted as local constant.
      • WM-4059 [Desktop Client] Fixed the execution of "SQL" subitems not containing a definition of the resulting file. The query is executed only one time instead of two.
      • WM-4075 [Desktop Client] Fixed the behavior of the "Paste" button in Desktop Client Main Menu / Right Click menu for date fields, money fields and dropdown fields. "Paste" simulates a combination of Ctrl+A and Ctrl+V shortcuts for date and money fields and searches for available values in the case of dropdowns.
      • WM-4077 [Desktop Client] Fixed migration process of .srd form files for "LIKE" and "AND" SQL keywords in form queries.
      • WM-4085 [Desktop Client] Fixed the issue with bouncing lines while moving down the "Sql Script" text field in Menu Item Editor.
      • WM-4093 [Desktop Client] Added checkbox "Skip string escape" (unchecked by default) for SQL menu subitem type. When checked, escaping procedure will not be executed during parsing of the configured SQL query.
      • WM-4105 [Desktop Client] Fixed the issue in export of information from data fields containing ".0" suffix when initiated by the "Save Data" action with the "Use original values" checkbox selected.
      • WM-4113 [Desktop Client] Supported SQL query result as a value for the "Result File Name" parameter of "SQL" subitems. The field content will be treated as a query if its value starts with SELECT or WITH. The query must return file path, including file name and extension.
      • WM-4119 [Desktop Client] Fixed the Index Out Of Bounds Exception on Empty Filter result.
      • OWS-75453/WM-4127 [Desktop Client] Changed the default hour value from "00" to "12" in date fields for regions where local date has "h/hh" and not "H/HH" value format for hours. More information on date formats can be found in https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html.
      • WM-4139 [Desktop Client] Fixed execution of the "Unpacking of original doc" procedure for "BUF_FORMAT" documents when the file server is located on a network drive.
      • WM-4141 [Desktop Client] Fixed NullPointerException that could appear on the main screen if "OK" button on Login screen was clicked several times.
      • WM-4143 [Desktop Client] Changed the fonts used by "bold fonts" and/or "large fonts" options. Added the ability to customize the fonts. Removed excessive scrollers added for the text fields when "bold fonts" and/or "large fonts" options are turned on. Changed the way to customize UI settings of Desktop Client for each particular user. Updated Manuals: Desktop Client | Desktop_Client_Manual
      • WM-4145 [Desktop Client] Fixed "'other' has different root" error appearing if remote HOME is used for creating Remote Access distribution.
      • WM-4147 [Desktop Client] Enhanced the procedure of "edit mask" field calculation. *mm/yy* mask is now considered as a *MM/yy* mask.
      • WM-4151 [Desktop Client] Fixed the behavior of the "Write additional report-state columns" checkbox in "Export > CSV" function.
      • OWS-76989/WM-4169 [Remote access] Removed server.xml from the RA server-part war file.
      • WM-4171 [Desktop Client] Improved performance of "Update Grants" procedure. Added support for filtering loaded groups by setting the "enable_groups_filtration" db.ini variable. Added the ability to increase the number of processing threads by setting the "update_grants_thread_count" db.ini variable.
      • OWS-76663/WM-4173 [Desktop Client] Fixed "Array index out of bounds exception: 0" error after applying an empty result filter to a form while a child form is open.
      • WM-4201 [Desktop Client] Added "Print Free Form as a Grid" preference for transformation of free form layouts to grid form layouts on "Print/Export" preview page and export into a file.
      • WM-4203 [Desktop Client] Fixed the issue with empty column headers in data exported to an Excel file via the "Save Data" function.
      • OWS-75457/WM-4219 [Desktop Client] Fixed the issue with incomplete copying of parameters in the "Duplicate" function of Menu Item Definition Editor.
      • WM-4231 [Desktop Client] Added desktop-client.bat and desktop-client.sh startup scripts to run Desktop Client application from HOME folder.
      • OWS-77625/WM-4237 [Desktop Client] Fixed saving for predefined queries that contain fields representing sensitive data. Customers that already have the predefined queries with such fields need to reset the value of the field and save the query again to use it.
      • WM-4239 [Desktop Client] Fixed "Copy" functionality for form fields with dropdowns.
      • WM-4251 [Desktop Client] Fixed evaluation of parameters '<parameter name="..." target="..."/>' in parallel execution of outward pipes.
      • WM-4273 [Desktop Client] Fixed the procedure of SQL query generation for "Set query for ..." form dialogs.
      • WM-4275 [Desktop Client] Fixed the issue with execution of PL/SQL blocks via "SQL Executor" in Desktop Client.
      • OWS-78919/WM-4283 [Desktop Client] Added "add quotes" checkbox for SQL parameters in Menu Item Editor. The checkbox is editable for file types other than "Excel". If the checkbox is selected, all exported strings will be surrounded with quotation marks.
      • OWS-76561/WM-4297 [Desktop Client] Improved synchronization process of Update Grants procedure.
      • WM-4301 [Desktop Client] Fixed missing border of combo boxes for Desktop Client started on Java 11 or later and without presence of -Dswing.noxp=true java argument.
      • WM-4329 [Desktop Client] Fixed the issue of current row position changing after modifications to filter conditions in form.
      • WM-4091 [Desktop Client] Ended support of Remote Access Server for RHEL7 OS starting from June 30, 2024. Updated Manuals: Remote access | Technical Requirements
      • WM-4261 [Desktop Client] Introduced new desktop-client.bat startup file in OWS_HOME versions 03.58.30 and 03.59.30 as an upcoming replacement for <HOME_CARDS>\client\way4manager\dbmanager\way4manager(64).exe files. Starting from OWS_HOME version 03.60.30, way4manager(64).exe files will be decommissioned and removed from the distribution.
